page.title: 20TRANSPORT IN CHEDWORTH
page.content: There are many different forms of transport in Chedworth.Most families have at least one car.They are used for shopping trips mostly to Cirencester,but also to Cheltenham,Northleach,Swindon and Gloucester.Some children come to school by car.Many parents in their cars go to work in Cirencester, Cheltenham and Swindon.There are school buses to Bourton on the Water,Northleach and Cirencester.Farmers use Landrovers and tractors to travel round their farms. In winter the snow and ice make the roads dangerous.Sometimes the cars can't get in or out of the village.Some young children come to school on sledges pulled by their parents.Bicycles are useful and some teen-agers go to work on mopeds. by IAN GOODALL RICHARD HOBART
